document: Data Mining Software: Introduction to Orange Data Mining

questions.question: Orange is a commercial data mining software that requires a license.
IBM SPSS Modeler was formerly known as Clementine.
R and RapidMiner are examples of commercial data mining software.
Orange is an open-source data visualization and machine learning toolkit.
Orange can only be used by people with advanced knowledge of mathematics and statistics.
Orange uses a drag-and-drop visual programming interface.
In Orange, widgets are computational units with inputs and outputs.
Orange can only work with .ows files (workflows).
Orange supports working with text files for text mining.
Orange files have a .orc extension.
Orange can work with tab, xls, csv files as well as SQL tables.
Orange cannot perform social media content scraping.
Orange's main interface is called a 'canvas' where you build workflows.
Orange widgets can be thought of as black boxes with defined functionality.
Orange requires programming knowledge to create data mining workflows.
Weka is an example of commercial data mining software.
Orange provides tools for labeling, zooming, and pausing model flow.
The Orange YouTube channel is not a recommended learning resource.
Orange can only be used for data exploration, not for making predictions.
SAS Enterprise Miner is a free open-source data mining tool.
Orange has add-ons for bioinformatics and image analytics.
Orange cannot perform cluster or segmentation analysis.
In Orange, workflows are built by writing Python code.
KDNuggets.com is mentioned as a source for data mining software information.
Orange cannot visualize data; it only performs data mining algorithms.
StatSoft Statistica Data Miner is a commercial data mining software.
Orange's toolbox is not important for learning the software.
Orange cannot discover patterns in data.
The Orange internet page is a good resource for learning.
Orange can perform text analysis.
Orange widgets cannot be placed on the canvas via drag and drop.
Orange is developed by Microsoft.
Orange can only handle numerical data, not text data.
IBM Intelligent Miner is a free data mining tool.
Orange's canvas is where you write programming code.
Orange has geo tagging add-ons available.
Orange cannot perform exploratory data analysis.
Orange's visual programming approach makes it user-friendly.
Orange is only available for Windows operating systems.
Orange can help scrape content from social media platforms.
